title: Add Terms of Use footer section and full Terms of Service page

requirements.text: Create a new `/terms` route in the TanStack Router configuration (App.tsx) that renders a dedicated TermsOfUsePage component, following the same pattern as the existing `/about` route.

quotes: add a section next to About Us , it will be called "Terms of Use"

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /terms renders the Terms of Use page without a 404 or blank screen
The route is registered under the shared Layout root route so the header and footer are visible

requirements.text: Create a TermsOfUsePage component that renders all 14 sections of the Terms of Service exactly as provided. All section headings, body text, bullet lists, sub-sections (e.g. Feedback, Mandatory Binding Arbitration, Class Action Waiver, Jury Trial Waiver, Small Claims, Emergency Relief, Venue), and the ALL-CAPS disclaimer blocks must be preserved verbatim. The support email must display as support@stackteacher.com (mailto link) and all references must read 'Stack Teacher'. The page must include the opening bold warning paragraph.

quotes: MAke sure not to loose any content

acceptanceCriteria: All 14 section headings are present and numbered correctly
The opening bold warning paragraph about age requirements is displayed
All bullet lists and sub-sections within each section are rendered completely
ALL-CAPS disclaimer blocks (Sections 4 and 5) are displayed in uppercase
support@stackteacher.com appears as a clickable mailto link
No Stack Teacher branding is missing or replaced with other company names
The copyright line 'Copyright © Stack Teacher. All rights reserved.' is present in Section 13

requirements.text: In the site footer (Layout.tsx), add a 'Terms of Use' link in the same footer section that contains the existing 'About Us' link, placed directly next to it. The link must navigate to the /terms route.

quotes: In the footer add a section next to About Us , it will be called "Terms of Use"

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Terms of Use' link appears in the footer immediately adjacent to the 'About Us' link
Clicking the 'Terms of Use' link navigates to /terms
The link styling is consistent with the existing 'About Us' footer link

constraints: Do not alter any existing routes, pages, or footer links other than adding the Terms of Use link next to About Us
Preserve every word, clause, bullet point, and section of the provided Terms of Service content — no content may be omitted or paraphrased
All brand references must read 'Stack Teacher', not 'Careerist' or any other name
nonGoals: Modifying the backend schema or any Motoko logic
Adding a Privacy Policy page or any other legal page
Changing the visual design or layout of existing pages
